title: filter_with_counts
description:
Filter scRNA-seq data based on the primary QC metrics. 
This is based on both the UMI counts, the gene counts 
and the mitochondrial genes (genes starting with mt/MT).

var_gene_names.description: .var column name to be used to detect mitochondrial genes instead of .var_names (default if not set).
var_gene_names.help_text:
.var column name to be used to detect mitochondrial genes instead of .var_names (default if not set). 
Gene names matching with the regex value from --mitochondrial_gene_regex will be identified
as a mitochondrial gene.

mitochondrial_gene_regex.description: Regex string that identifies mitochondrial genes from --var_gene_names.
mitochondrial_gene_regex.help_text:
Regex string that identifies mitochondrial genes from --var_gene_names.
By default will detect human and mouse mitochondrial genes from a gene symbol.

do_subset.description: Whether to subset before storing the output.

obs_name_filter.description: In which .obs slot to store a boolean array corresponding to which observations should be removed.

var_name_filter.description: In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding to which variables should be removed.

min_counts.description: Minimum number of counts captured per cell.

max_counts.description: Maximum number of counts captured per cell.

min_genes_per_cell.description: Minimum of non-zero values per cell.

max_genes_per_cell.description: Maximum of non-zero values per cell.

min_cells_per_gene.description: Minimum of non-zero values per gene.

min_fraction_mito.description: Minimum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

max_fraction_mito.description: Maximum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

param_list.description: Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
param_list.help_text:
Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
A csv should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline.
A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline.
A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a parameter.
Inside the Nextflow pipeline code, params.params_list can also be used to directly a list of parameter sets.
When passing a csv, json or yaml, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file.

param_list_format.description: Manually specify the param_list_format. Must be one of 'csv', 'json', 'yaml', 'yaml_blob', 'asis' or 'none'.
